meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect into ten parts.
meanings.sent1: She carefully decupled the string into ten equal pieces.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for decupling the ingredients before mixing them together.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he attempted to decuple the puzzle pieces but ended up mixing them up even more.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to decuple the deck of cards with a swift flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent5: The task of decupling the tangled wires proved to be more challenging than expected.

meanings.sent1: The company's profits decupled after implementing the new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent2: With hard work and dedication, she managed to decuple her savings in just a year.
meanings.sent3: The plant growth decupled overnight, surprising the gardener in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room seemed to decuple as the concert drew closer.
meanings.sent5: The impact of his words decupled the motivation of the team.
